definition: lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to vomit/to throw up
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
surname Na
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)

sentences.english: New life keeps the energy flowing, like the breath of the world.
sentences.chinese: 新的生命将持续着能量的流动，世界正在吐故纳新。

sentences.english: Breathing got self-renewing, but produced foam accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸作用得到了吐故纳新，但产生了泡沫的堆积。

sentences.english: That's because they were able to connect experiences they've had and synthesize new things.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为他们能把种种体验关联起来，并吐故纳新。

definition: lit. flowing water does not rot, nor a door-hinge rust (idiom)/fig. constant activity prevents decay
pinyin: liu2 shui3 bu4 fu3 , hu4 shu1 bu4 du4

definition: to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
flowing water does not rot
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
going with nature and the seasons (TCM)
to free the mind from worries
to turn over a new leaf
to grow and multiply without end
lit. drain away filth and bring in fresh water (idiom); fig. dispel evil and usher in good/eliminate vice and exalt virtue
lit. a door hinge never becomes worm-eaten/constant activity prevents decay (idiom)
to clean up
orderly and logical (of writing)/luxuriant/flourishing/prosperous
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
lit. to get rid of the weeds and keep the flowers/to separate the wheat from the chaff (idiom)
